Reviews.Title: “All Riviera - Always the best”
Reviews.Author: pinklady13
Reviews.Content: We have been going there for 9 years. Found it when we took the bus from Cancun and spent the day. We looked for a hotel to stay at off 5th and on the beach. We go 1-2 times a year when we can. We are from NY and look for the ambiance of a small, personal hotel which suites us perfectly. We cannot say enough about the owners and their staff who take care of us and our well being while being in another country where we do not speak the language. This is our home in Playa del Carmen and we are staying with family, from the cleanliness to the service on the beautiful beach. We are looking forward to being with you very soon. Jackie & Hank aka pinklady13@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Playa del Carmen Mexico”
Reviews.Author: chicorico1030
Reviews.Content: I was in Playa del Carmen for Christmas day and New Years Eve, I have an awesome time, my and a friend did not want to go on an all inclusive, we decided to stayed in Down Town area, the Hotel is not a 5 Stars is about 3and half to 4 Stars, but is great, very clean, Maria was our cleaner, people was great, Armando in Recepcion and many other Character people, we ask to have the European breakfast in the morning, wish is a coffe or orage fruit, with eggs or just toast bread and some aditional desert, since me and my friend likes to eat alot and we are used to the real breakfast . Since I am original from there and Continue with my trip information,I know where to go so early in the morning was a time for the Taco breakfast, if I want it to eat something heavy for breakfast or if for a healthy breakfast 100 per cent Natural rest. right on 5 ave and calle between 10 and 12 amazing breakfast, during my time I walk back and for all day looking for some gifts for my friends, wish I always get the best prices just not because I am a mexican or some kind of cheap, just know how to talk to people, at this point and so far, we continue our beach time, chasing the ladies all over the beach and relaxing, drinking some Margaritas, pina colada, bears, tequila, you name it!!. we stay at the beach for 7 days, we meet with pancho wish is a great guy, works for the restaurant and bar for the resort, I know him for a quit a bit , since I was a local Once, so Pancho took care of us for the 7 days, obviously happy pancho" s day in the end of our trip, we left to him a good tip, Any ways just it to promote Panchos Treat. In my trip to playa del carmen, let me tell you about Chrismast business are open all day and bars all night, Normally every one is having a good time with their families, but alot of people work even on a raining day. New years eve is even crazy, on 5ave everyone is walking to the bars, some shops are open until 9pm others continue open. the party on that night is everywhere, but if you want to see a good party where everyone get together"s is on the 5 Avenida and calle 12, more than 6oo people celebrating the New years eve, is amazing how so many people is partying on the street. Another crazy place to celebrated is in Coco Bongo, open bar all night long, well until 3 am or a bit more sometimes...... waooo, so next time you are in playa remember, pancho, tacos by the bus station and church, shopping on 5 ave are good bargains. during the day

Reviews.Title: “Clean but nothing special. BUT... 5 star location!”
Reviews.Author: mintoh
Reviews.Content: Great location! Step out of your room and onto the beach! or 2 minutes walk to 5th Avenue with great shopping, wonderful food and amazing atmosphere. Rooms are a little small, and bathrooms even smaller, air-conditioning a little loud, and the hotel could definitely use an update. Also, continental breakfast included in the room price only equals toast with jam, juice & coffee (eggs and bacon are extra). HOWEVER, the location, friendly and helpful staff and clean rooms more than make up for the outdated fittings. And, I guess it they updated the place, it wouldn't be such great value! Just don't expect a fancy 5 star place and you'll be more than satisfied :)

Reviews.Title: “Being on the Beach upgrades this place!”
Reviews.Author: lehookedontravel
Reviews.Content: We really liked staying here as it is right on the beach. The rooms are "typical" Mexican rooms meaning the bare essentials including a small fridge. Very clean and well maintained. We had a king size bed and they were going to be purchasing new mattresses that were to be softer so that would be a bonus. They were very accommodating with providing us with a foamy for on top of the mattress we had. The people who worked the attached cafe and bar were very nice. The level of massage offered by the pool was exemplary and very reasonable for 1/2 to 1 hour full body massages. They were professional in every way. This area of Playa del Carmen is quiet so we didn't have to listen to Blue Lagoon and the other noisy places further up the strip. There is a bigger bar next door and it shuts down very early. Walking along the beach and eating at various beach restaurants provided plenty of wonderful food and drink. I took a Magic Bullet with me as I like Margaritas so made them in the room and put it in a small thermos as the drinks were quite expensive and not the best Tequilla! (PS go to Walmart and get a good bottle of Tequilla!) We have been to Playa del Carmen 13 times over the years and the food is impressive, good people watching on 5th Ave at night (or during the day!).

Reviews.Title: “Price, Location, and Right on the Beach, are you kidding me...NO”
Reviews.Author: danielc805
Reviews.Content: Step out of your balcony with a table and chairs, room #207 and you see the beach and ocean right in front of you, the pool is very, very small, also has a hot tub next to the pool. 2 blocks from the main pier to go to Cozumel which is a 5-minute walk, as well as the main bus station to go to anywhere in Mexico, and the main street were all the action is as, all for $50.00 per night but you have to pay for 2-nights and 3rd night is free, the free breakfast is just a glass of OJ white bread toast and all the coffee you can drink, the room is nice, clean bathroom, big bed, a small refrigerator to keep the beers and goodies cold, overhead fan, table with chairs, open the glass door to the balcony and all the fresh cool ocean breeze you can handle, perfect for the tourist who are on the go all day and just need a nice clean secure hotel on the beach to come home in the afternoons, Plus all the Maya ruins and Family parks are just behind you in the jungle of playa del carmen, all very close. Re; restaurants to eat; the main street has some of the most beautiful looking restaurants you will see in Playa Carmen, if you don't want to pay high prices from eating on the main street just go off any side streets and you will find really low prices and good food, if you want to eat on the beach the restaurant right next to the hotel just step out the back of the hotel and turn right; A whole fish grilled with all the goodies was just 50-70 pesos, large seafood cocktail was the same price and you can bring your own cold beers (your hotel is next door) and your eating right on the beach under the stars and cool ocean breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at All Riviera Resort”
Reviews.Author: travelanywhere33
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that was on the beach and close to the activity...we found it! Everyone was wonderful, rooms were basic but perfect for people like us that only are in their room to sleep. Restaurant attached gave us great service on the beach.....buck of Sol, over and over again. three store fronts away from 5th Ave where we ate, drank and shopped too much! Pool is very small but who wants a pool when you have the ocean. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “All Riviera - Always the Best”
Reviews.Author: pinklady13
Reviews.Content: Location on the beach, off 5th is the best. Acomodations very clean, very comfortable. The people who took care of us make it the best including the house keepers, the laundry people who washed and ironed our sheets and towels, everything always smells so good and the way they folded our towels...wow. Luis, Mario and Juan who took care of us on the beach and Jose at the bar. Our dear friend Pedro and our new friend Miguel at the front desk. Lastly, but not least another very dear friend for 8 years, Hector who always is there for us and Lazirlo. Playa del Carmen is beautiful but our friends at All Rivera Resort make it very special. Feel free to email me - [--] if you would like additional information. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “remarkable value on the beach”
Reviews.Author: nosun-nofun
Reviews.Content: This wasnt my first rodeo in Playa. I have stayed many times in last 10 years. I have been to Playa Maya, Grand Porto, Fusion, Royal, Grand Coco, Las Palapas, Illusion, Aventuras Mexicana, Azul 5's, Petitte Lafittes, Luna Encanta, and lots of AI's up and down the coast. The aforementioned hotels are all good or good enough and have lots to offer. However its my purpose here to let all who read this know how good this small beachfront hotel is. It is older but in good working condition. The staff are efficient, friendly and competent. Its a well run, safe hotel with a great location and view. The pricing of the rooms I feel cannot be beat for a beachfront hotel in Playa. I had a beachfront room and could look north on the beach all the way to Gran Porto and south to ferry pier to Coz. Its a wonderful way to wake up. (rooms face east.) Some peopelo coplain about the noise coming from the all night beach club at the other end of the beach (Blue Parrot) but the volume at the All Riviera end is muted somewhat and your airconditioner will drown most of it. The beach club, Bad Boys is right beside the room I had...next door north, but their band only plays on Thurs and Saturday nights from 5 to 9. Its a fun to enjoy this busy spot and with your room right next door, you dont have to endure the Bad Boys washrooms or the drunken greybacks that inhabit the site.The location is remarkable and there are plenty of places to explore and eat and drink nearby. The All Riviera's beach club seems to be run by Mario who is congenial and hustles to please. Staying here allows free beach chairs and it doesnt hurt if you offer to buy Mario a beer to have with you. So to wrap this up.....The All Riviera Hotel is a remarkable value that allows access "right on the beach" Unlike some of the hotels that you get a "view" of the beach.(or in some cases no view) I heartedly recommend this hotel. And despite the fact I have been to Playa so many times.........this is my first Trip Advisor review... they deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect to have your base in Playa and go around the Riviera”
Reviews.Author: cbkr11
Reviews.Content: The location is great, three blocks from the port to Cozumel,one from the ADO bus, two from the minivans that go to Tulúm, Puerto Morelos and Cancún. Just 10 mts from the beach, actually basic continental breakfast is served on the small bar on the beach, and you can use the chairs, umbrellas and towels. Just tip the guys, they are really nice. The room is basic, ours had ocean view and it was a pleasure to seat on the small balcony looking at the full moon over the white sand beach and the sea after a long journey around Tulúm and Cobá. It seemed just like a pousada in the north east of Brazil. We wanted a simple clean room, and the beach just a few steps away was a plus. We got what we pay for and are more than happy with it. The staff at the front desk were all very sweet and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DapperDon51
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little run down, but you get what you pay for. There is a little cantina in the hotel which gave us the taste of real Mexico. The location is wonderful...one block from 5th St and 3 blocks from the ferry to Cosemel(sp). The best thing about the hotel was the staff. They were the most friendly and helpful of any hotel I have ever stayed at...and I have stayed at 5 star hotels before.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel directly to the beach and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Alexander_Astrid
Reviews.Content: clean hotel with affordable price in the Center of Playa del Carmen, friendly people. Great view to the beach, Manager was very courteous to us and our baby. You have to rent a parking lot, if you are here by car. If You park on the street, be aware to park 15 Meters away from the next crossing street - otherwise You get a police-ticket and the car plate will be removed - you get it back at the police office after paying. Alexander & Astrid

Reviews.Title: “I will be going back to All Riviera next year.”
Reviews.Author: Lisadwilliams
Reviews.Content: I stayed at All Riviera for 10 days in September. I was a little concerned because older reviews were not great. They must have had a management change or something because it was clean, staff was great and good service. The price was great when I booked on Bestday.com. The first thing I checked for was bedbugs, as I do at all hotels. There were none. There was also no noise problem or anything wrong with the room. For a beachfront hotel, you can't beat the price. It was very nice, with good size room, A/C, fridge, pool and Miguel at the front desk was always nice. As a woman travelling alone I felt very safe there and safe even out walking at night. I have stayed at four or five other hotels in Playa del Carmen, some were mediocre and others were good--Intercontinenal (different name now) ***, Labna *, Hotel Delphine ** (good but not beach front), Mimi del Mar*** right next door. All Riviera was the best for me with the combination of price and amenities. The only issue I had was that it was the low season there and local people struggle to make much money during the low season. The waiters were polite, but I really didn't want to pay tourist prices for food or drinks, so I felt bad for them when I turned down invitations from them to get drinks there. I hope to return in May and next September and I will definitely stay at All Riviera. For those interested in saving some money, don't pay $40 or $50 for hotel shuttles at the airport. Go to the Ado desk at the airport and take the local bus direct from Cancun to Playa del Carmen for $10, 2 blocks away from All Riviera. Book your return trip to the airport a day or two before departure at the bus station. Very important to check what terminal your return flight is on. You need to know this in order to get off at the right stop from the bus. Most people get off at terminal 2. I did this one time and it was a problem because the shuttles between terminals were not good. I usually fly US Air and leave from Terminal 3. Easy, but you have to know which terminal you need. One other word of advice is to stay away from the time share people, unless you want to spend hours of your vacation with high pressure sales people, who have you hostage at their resort. They will eventually bring you back, but for sure a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Top little hotel with the real Mexican Hacienda Feel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rooboy59
Reviews.Content: Arriving late at night, I stayed here for 9 nights in Rm 206 and although first impression was a bit on the down side, once I actually got into my room on the second floor and had a look around and then opened the door to the balcony, my mood changed to the positive. the hotel was exactly what I wanted instead of a big fancy resort, it had a real Mexican feel about it. It's not perfect but it's very functional. Being right on the beach with the distant lights of Cozumel in the distance made for a great spot to have a relaxing drink after a days travel from Jamaica. The views of the beach during the day were always good too not that I spent much time doing it as I only needed to take ten steps to reach one of the lazyboys or tables set up by the beach crew every morning to start a lazy day soaking up the sun with a constannt supply of Coronas or anything else one wanted. One morning I woke to the sight of a Celebrity cruise liner barely 750 mtrs off shore where she stayed all day, very impressive sight. There is a ferry terminal to Cozumel a few minutes walk up the beach and is defifnately worth the 35 to 40 min trip accross, especially if your a diver or just luv the water. Back to the resort, it is just a 100mtrs to 5th Avenue where you will find every conceivable type of shop available plus a massive range of restaurants and eateries and everywhere you can get a drink till the wee hours of the morning. Dont be afraid of exploring the side streets either for interesting places to eat and drink. The staff at the hotel are very friendly, even if their English is not the best, you will be looked after and not left wanting. The wireless internet is only accessable from the lobby but there are two comfortable lounges to use and being a small place, I never found it difficult to get a spot. Not exactly high speed but reliable. To balance all this I would say that the pool could be a bit cleaner as it appeared cloudy for all but 2 days but then I didn't use it with the beach right there but some family groups used it daily. The other slight negative is the onsite restaurant which although provides good service with ok food at good prices, could use a spruce up, again the staff are friendly and obliging. The hotel next to the Riviera to the left looking out to sea, has a banner called the bad boys club, they have a band play Thursdays and Saturdays from about 6 to 10pm, don't expect any sleep during this period but you wouldn't want to because the band is excellent and plays a great range of 60's and 70's mainly rock n roll and the drinks are cold and food are well priced. the rest of the time I found the hotel to be fairly quiet with little room next door noise as the norm. So, in a nutshell, I would stay here again anytime, Playa Del Carmen is an awesome place and with all the history of the Mayan civilization in easy reach, the ruins etc and the general atmosphere, the cleanliness of the whole place and the people, I would recommend this as a must do destination. finally, the hotel offered every 3rd night free and a continental breakfast so it was a good deal overall, there are cheaper places I know but this one lived up to what I expected and then exceeded them. Happy travels and hope this helps, enjoy your stay in a taste of paradise ! PS: $12USD 1Hr massages just around the corner in next street are awesome or there is one right on the beach in front of the hotel for a few dollars more !

Reviews.Title: “good deal for this price range”
Reviews.Author: Julia71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a week. Apr.25-May 2. Location is great - right on the beach, close to 5th Avenue, ferry dock to Cozumel and bus station. Even it's located in the very heart of Playa, it's very quite at night. Rooms are spacious with a fridge, TV and AC. We've stayed in room 207 and 205 and both of them have an amaring ocean view. Staff is attentive and friendly. For the last 5 years it was our 6th trip to Mayan Riviera and 3rd staying in not All Inclusive. Their bed linen could have been newer, as well as towels. Still, I have to say that for this price ($82 US per night, 3rd night is free) it is a very good deal. I would give this hotel 5 points if not the breakfast. I agree, you cannot expect any miracle from a Continental breakfast included in the price, but come on - serve orange juice made from a powder in Mexico - that's a total disgrace! I also could swallow instant cofee instead of brewed, but I don't want to use a powder Coffee Mate for my coffee. I don't understand why they cannot serve a regular milk with a coffee. Other than that we have enjoyed our stay and if the price is right would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me”
Reviews.Author: EnergyStockholm
Reviews.Content: It is a small hotel with very friendly and helpful stuff. The rooms are clean and nice, freezer and TV at the room. You can get the vew towards the tourcouse Karibian see without it cost you a fortune. Everything is just around you, shops, restaurants, food stors, bars, busstation, Mac Donalds, I just love the place! I have been there twice. They do all they can to get the guests pleased! You can easy get a chair on the beach in front of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: notonlybaseball
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from another wonderful vacation at All Riviera in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. It could not have been better and the staff, Jorge, Pedro, Victor, Hector, Lazirlo, Mario, Juanito, Luis, Adolpho and Senor Barracho, who makes the best margarita’s always took care of us. The rooms are extremely clean and the housekeepers kept us guessing everyday with the shapes of towels. The room was always neat and clean as were the beach and the grounds. Over the past few years, there have been renovations in the rooms and the property. The location could not be any better. It on 2nd Street between 5th Avenue and the beach. Each room has a balcony and the rooms have an ocean view. The staff are friendly and speak English and we always feel safe there. We are excited to be returning in July with our family. Yes, it will be hot, but the air conditioning will be fine when we are in our rooms. Otherwise we will be under an umbrella on the beautiful beach or cooling ourselves in the ocean or pool. If you have any questions, please email us at notonlybaseball@aol.com or pinklady13@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Pay for the "OCEAN FRONT", get an "OCEAN VIEW"!”
Reviews.Author: jdltwo
Reviews.Content: We had been to Mexico before, had low expectations on the room as far as cleanliness. We were more concerned with being able to look out the window and see the beach and the ocean. We booked an "OCEAN FRONT" room and paid more for it than the "OCEAN VIEW" room. When we got to the hotel, the desk clerk walked us to an "OCAN VIEW" room that overlooked the pool and the other balconies. When we explained that we had paid for the "OCEAN FRONT" room he said that the travel agent or website we booked through sold us the wrong room and there was nothing he could do for us. Well-- we'll do something for them and never come back there as well as letting everyone we know about how they switch your "RESERVATIONS" without refunding the difference.

Reviews.Title: “I CONSIDER MY SELF A SMART TRAVELER, BELIEVE ME AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: niklaus
Reviews.Content: Have you ever wondered how a vacation in a wonderful place can be ruined, just try staying at All Riviera Resort. When some friends and I planned the trip, we selected the hotels based on location, apparent quality of the hotel and price, but don’t be fooled by the pictures, surely you may think that any hotel by the Caribbean sea will be beautiful, but once we arrived at the All Riviera Resort we were astounded by the filthiness of the place, not to mention the rude attention we received. The bed sheets were dark gray, so you wouldn’t be able to see all the stain spots, the towels were almost black, probably so you couldn’t tell if they were clean or dirty. Before complaining we asked for clean bed sheets and they just kept on bringing these extremely filthy bed sheets, always with a bad attitude. Finally we decided to go to another hotel and for a small difference we stayed in a wonderful place. They almost ruined our vacations. Considering there are many other hotels in Playa del Carmen that offer what you expect, be careful not to choose All Riviera Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: mbeehan
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel with my parents and girlfriend. The rooms were iffy at first glance. Upon further review we discovered the following problems between two rooms: dirty sheets in both rooms(complete with all kinds of hair and dirt), mold in both AC units, broken shower door in one room, toilet water leaking in other room, and a shower that wouldn't drain in one room. My mother asked the front desk to fix the shower the night we arrived, but they didnt do anything. When my girlfriend and I discovered the dirty sheets, we had to go get "clean sheets" and change them ourselves because the only employee in the hotel after 7 PM is the securtiy guard. No front desk, no manager, no one. So we decided to leave the next day due to all these problems. We agreed to pay for the first night because we stayed, but we said we wanted our money back for the second night. At first they didnt want to give it to us because of some cancelation policy. We had to call the travel company we made the arrangements with as well as argue with the lady in charge for about 2 hours or so. Eventually they gave us our money back for the second night, but my father had to show them the pictures and video he took of all the problems.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mardilla
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind sleeping in a hard mattress, and showering in a small and old bathroom built with the cheapest materials, this might be for you. We got an ocean front room, but we had to fight the sliding door to being able to enjoy the view. We got there at 11 am, and had to wait until 3pm to get the room because they were cleaning it, but even after 3pm we still got a dirty room. All the mess left from the last guests was all over the place, so we had to leave our things there and leave so they could clean. Even the next day they didn't come to clean the room until 6pm. It is a real shame they don't really take care of this place. It could be very nice with a little bit of TLC. Until then I will never go there again. I rather not have the view.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: travelingchickTexas
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 4 night stay at the All riviera in Playa Del Carmen. Excellent location. On the beach next to restaurants and shopping. Major downer was the beds. Very hard. Tolerable until the 3rd night. Im not one to complain so we toughed it out. Beachside service was very attentive and accomidating. My pregnant partner could not find her perfect lounge chair and they never gave up. Even fixed and created virgin drinks just for her. Room came with breakfast however we ate out every morning. Overall, very good location and service for the price. Also felt very safe. There is a night guard in front and patroling.

Reviews.Title: “don't listen to the poor reviews!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fionachristchurch
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel (the first time - 2004). I must admit that some of the poor reviews made wonder if I had made the wrong choice, but I was wrong. This was my best stay ever!!!, I had an excellent room (all the rooms have an ocean view) but mine was more than I could have asked for. The staff, both at reception and the 'beach staff' were just the best. Thanks to Mario,Victor and Juan for their great service. always friendly, remembered your name and made my stay very enjoyable. l will definately be back!! I look forward to catching up with "my boys" in the future Thanks again, keep up the good work Love Fiona, New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation”
Reviews.Author: AmySanRafael
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the beach and the pool, although small, is also right on the beach, unlike any others that I saw. The hotel is on the quieter and less touristy end of the beach and a quick walk to the ferry to Cozamul. Fifth street is one block away and has all the restaurants and shops you could ask for on a pedestrian only street. You have to park 1.5 blocks away and walk to the hotel but that is true for any of the hotels on the beach since 5th is closed to cars. The views were amazing and the beach right by the hotel was sandy and pretty calm. The rooms were cleaned each day very nicely. The a/c worked and there were ceiling fans and screens on the sliding door to the balcony as well. Although some of the previous complaints are true - some of the towels had frayed edges and some of the beds were hard, most of the towels were thick and plush and 4 of the 5 beds we tried were soft. (We switched rooms because the triple limited view room was over a bar that although it closed at 10 pm was too loud for our kids to sleep and we wanted the better views and didn't need the large suite. They were very accommodating when we asked to change rooms.) The A/C in one room was noisy but the other room was fine. We would stay there again if we went to Playa again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinklady13
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 6th year at All Riviera. Once again we had a fantastic time. The room we had was beautiful and clean when we arrived and cleaned everyday. We did not have a problem with paying for the room or anything else. The margaritas are big and delicious and the shrimp cerviche and nachos are our favorites for lunch. We just love sitting at the beach and ordering from our chairs. The guys at the beach, Mario, Victor and Jose really took great care of us and were extremely attentive. Jorge and Pedro at the front desk speak English and are there to help with anything and can answer any questions for example, we forgot how to use the air conditioner and they just came up and showed us. This was not an all inclusive so we tipped people when they helped us which is what one usually does, even at home in New York. The pictures which we have seen on the website are accurate. If you have any questions, please feel free to email me at pinklady13@aol.com.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here ...”
Reviews.Author: ClockDoc1948
Reviews.Content: The location right on the beach is the only thing this place has going for it ! We had reserved the room last summer, paid two nights in advance by credit card. When we checked in the clerk wanted an additional cash deposit, no credit cards, even though we could see the machine. When we got to the room our jaws dropped, OMG, what a dive. The room was nothing like the pictures on the web site.The ceiling fan was clicking loudly with each revolution, holes in the sheets & blankets, only one towel for three people and that had 2 inch strings hanging out the end. The refrigerator was a college dorm style that was warm and rusty. The air conditioner was mounted up on the wall out of reach, not sure how to turn it on. My wife, who has traveled to many foreign places, said "I can't stay here !" We were all very depressed and disappointed at that point. We left our luggage and walked South towards Playa Car and the big resorts, short story is we found a fabulous condo for rent right across from the Reef resort for double the money but so worth it. We went back and got our additional cash deposit back but are still working on getting one of the two nights credit card deposit back. The clerk gave us the run around, lied out of both sides of his mouth and wasn't helpful at all. There is no way I could recommend this place to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Long time coming”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2022
Reviews.Content: Shame on me for not heeding the warning signs through trip advisor. The travel agent I used assured me this place had been upgraded and was great. Nothing else was available so I took a chance. The rooms was old and musty. I just wanted to cry when I walked in the room. There was mold growing on the walls in the bathroom. The beds were hard as the floor. I complained about the mold and housekeeper did come in and scrub away what she could. There is no decent lighting whatsoever. The over all grounds were in great need of cleaning and upgrading Since our room was booked and paid for in advance we felt like we had no choice but to tough it out and make the best of it. I did try to get them to switch out mattresses, but that was way lost in translation. The people manning the beach chairs were rude and more interested in closing down for the day than accomidating paying guests. They take your chair away at 3:45PM. They also like to drink beer very early in the morning on the side of the building where they think you can't see them. We staying in January and I should have posted this a long time ago, but I don't spend much time doing negative things. I have just been feeling obligated to get this out to those who may be considering this property. Maybe things have changed since January. Doubtful

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: tolkarovers
Reviews.Content: AMAZING location: right on the beach, beside the ferry, close to ALL shops and resteraunts. Rooms are simple but have all you need. Staff are VERY friendly and relaxed. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best massage!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luxuriant
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend received a massage from, "The Luxuriant," and they made our vacation in Playa del Carmen invigorating. The therapists know how to work out all those kinks that you never knew existed. The setting was comforting and clean in the spa with music and AC. They also offer massages on top of All Riviera Hotel overlooking the beach. We only paid $35 each, which was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are extremely deceiving”
Reviews.Author: gossipgirl1
Reviews.Content: I will never, ever suggest this hotel to anyone. It was the most dirty hotel I have ever stayed at. The pictures online are extremely deceiving. First of all, when we arrived, we waited 3 hours for our room to be ready. They kept saying, "20 minutes," and we kept going to the front desk asking them to hurry up. The pool is very small. The rooms are extremely trashy. Our towels were frayed on the ends and the shower door was rusty. The door into our room was held shut with a metal bolt. There was no clock, kleenex, and no lock for the safe (which they wanted us to put down a refundable $50 deposit to use..glad we didn't). The beds are extremely uncomfortable and are held up by a cement block. Also, the A/C is ran by a fuse box that you had to keep switching on and off. The bathroom and shower are very small and so dirty they are uncleanable. The lounge chairs at the beach cost $10 day. The free breakfast consists of 2 pieces of burnt toast, butter/jelly, and no silverware. Also, we chose between fruit or a small glass (about shot glass size) of orange juice. We also ate lunch one day at the hotel and the food wasn't bad, but the prices are extremely high for the amount of food we got. I suggest go to the restaurant down the beach. There are also stray cats that run around the hotel because the hotel is open. One of the cats peed all over our door, which we were not very happy about. Needless to say, if you are wanting to stay at a hotel in Playa del Carmen, don't pick this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice Please Read!!!”
Reviews.Author: grasshopper3721
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend, her brother, his girlfriend, and I all went to All Riviera again this past week. I have read a lot of bad reviews concerning this hotel and I would like to add some comments about our experience. The All Riviera is probably the most moderately priced hotels that is directly on the beach. Great beach actually, because other hotels near All Riviera have whole beaches of rocks. The All Riviera, being moderately priced, has everything my party and I need for a wonderful vacation: Clean rooms, great service, best views, cold air, cable tv, rooms directly on the beach, prime location on 5th avenue, cheap price, secure rooms, hot water and moderate included breakfast. The only issue we had was the front row beach chairs like so many others had commented on. We just went to the front desk and the problem was solved. Most all the other comments seem to be from people whom expect the hotel to be just like a Holiday Inn in America or something like that. THIS IS MEXICO PEOPLE! You can't expect 5 star quality rooms and service from the All Riviera. Our simple expectations were more than met by the staff at the All Riviera. I hope you all give this lovely hotel a chance instead of comparing it to the Waldorf or the likes. Best views and beach for the price. Thanks again All Riviera!! Check out pictures for details of room views and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Aboslutley Love All Riviera!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLove41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you want a cute little place to stay at. It has a nice little restaurant perfect for breakfast and lunch, and also perfect for drinks all day ;) It blows my mind that someone would write that the staff wants tips all the time. Firstly, we never had an experience where we felt they were EXPECTING a tip. We tip them to be nice....we learned from one of the staff they make less than 33 cents an hour. They slave away to our every need in the hot sun all day and they make close to nothing for it, of course you tip them!!! It's located in a great area, right off of 5th Avenue. Now if you're expecting something super fancy this isn't the place. It's cute, and comfortable. It was perfect. The staff is super nice and friendly. They were also very accommodating when we would ask the maid to come back later, or for an extra pillow. We will definatley be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: BloomyMinnesota
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of a friend who stayed down the beach and said it looked nice. It did look nice online, however when we arrived my husband was not impressed. The room and bathroom was half the size. The free breakfast was ok if you only wanted 1 or 2 things to chose from everyday. They would mess up your bill for food if you would eat for lunch. Of course yes the chairs for $5.00 per person you could have the front chairs if you ordered drinks. They wanted tips for everything. When we checked out we asked if we could ck out 2 hours later well that was $20.00 more. The only nice thing was the beach and water in my book I would not stay there again. It is not what it looks like from the web.

Reviews.Title: “Great for college students but not for those seeking peace and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: SORORockland_Maine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for the party crowd. College students might love the fact that there are bars on either side of the hotel. We had the oceanfront room. It has a patio with chairs. The problem with this particular space is that staff and tourists feel it is a passageway to the next bar. It is clearly a separate and meant to be a private space that is not respected. This may be a welcoming addition for those that like to party, it did not work for us. The location is ideal for 5th Avenue and the Cozumel ferry station. Also, the beach in front of the All-Riviera is short. Do not expect to have any space between you and whomever. Now let's talk about the noise. It was endless. Typically the bar next door would start blaring music starting at about 10 in the morning. The music would play well into the early afternoon at a fevered pitch. Again, if you are into partying all day/all night All-Riviera is for you. Also, the bar next door on Thursdays and Saturdays has live music from 4-8PM. What this boils down to is very little quiet and a lot of endless frenzied activity. The room does have a fridge that works. The local phone did not work and the cable tv had so much interference that it was basically unwatchable. We reported this but no action was ever taken. There was an afternoon we returned to the room to discover there was no water in the bathroom. The shower is a weak stream. There is a sliding glass door in the room. There is no air or windows except for a small one in the bathroom. We put a stick in the sliding glass door to allow some breeze into the room at night. We thought it would be safe to keep the door open 4 inches at night. At about 3AM we awoke to a man shining a flashlight into our room. The door was secure but our privacy was not. This complaint may be one for the books. If you want to sit on the beach in front of the ocean, staff will ask you for 200 pesos or you are encouraged to eat and drink for the day. (One mother and daughter complained and were able to get reimbursed from the front desk.) We refused to pay. Why stay at a resort if you are not allowed to use the beach front property. You can be on the beach but you must be in the second or third row of chairs. The breakfast is adequate but you are never sure what time it will be. The staff (sans our cleaning person Olga) was indifferent to us. Client satisfaction is not part of the equation. The staff was dismssive and at times would be outright rude to the guests. This is a One Star Hotel. Perfect for the party set.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not great”
Reviews.Author: Willow-Jen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between xmas and New Year's for 4 nights. The first room we were in - 303 - is at the back of the hotel and was pretty dreadful. This was a so-called mini-suite and it was fairly sizeable with two bathrooms. However, neither shower worked properly and to suggest this room has an ocean view is misleading. Mirrors were not hung but rather resting on the vanities. It appeared the room was under renovation but not completed. It had been pre-arranged for us to move to one of the rooms facing the pool (with genuine views to the ocean) for the remaining nights. This room was much better albeit standard hotel room size. It was fairly sterile in ambiance but we were ok with it. Beds are ultra, ultra firm. Shower was great. Little balcony with ocean view was enjoyable. Staff in restaurant were very accommodating. Beach is skinny -- quite a bit of erosion -- but there was still plenty of room for chaise lounges and umbrellas. We found the beach set-up fine and the view was nice. Hotel's web site says all rooms have hair dryers. Not true. When I asked at the desk I was told that only some rooms receive them and there were no extra ones. I had to go to WalMart and buy one which ticked me off. Location was very good in our view. One block to 5th Avenue and all the restaurants and shops. If I go back to Playa del Carmen I will probably try a different hotel. However, I wouldn't necessarily try to disuade someone from staying here as long as one approaches it with realistic expectations. In summary it was 'so-so' however it does appear that the property is underdoing a lot of renovating and improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessenia
Reviews.Content: I booked the All Riviera through a link by trip advisor without first reading reviews. After reading many reviews I was terrified of staying there. I would like to begin by saying I think that people who expect 5 star hotels should book 5 star hotels. The All Riviera Resort was Excellent. 3 girlfriends and myself stayed for 3 nights and it was beautiful waking up to the ocean waves every morning. Breakfast was really good, actually better than a little restaurant that we chose to have breakfast at on the first day. The staff was very friendly, I will add that we all did speak spanish so I can not confirm if the staff knew english or not, but you are in Mexico at a 2 star hotel, what you should expect is clean accomodations and a friendly staff, and that is exactly what the All Riviera offers. It is practically a skip and a jump away from the bus station, (which i may suggest taking the bus $8 from the airport as opposed to a taxi or shuttle which could run you from $35-$40) The short walk eliminated you having to walk a mile with your luggage on 5th ave. since there is are no cars(taxis) allowed on 5th. The hotel is also very close to the Ferry which takes you to cozumel. I just wanted to write a review because after reading so many negative reviews about this hotel, and after having such a nice experience I had to give them some credit. Thank you All Riviera for making my stay in Playa wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, nice location”
Reviews.Author: didi4423
Reviews.Content: Nice location, excellent beach, close to 5th Ave. Staff was really nice to us. You do need to keep your doors shut and locked due to the balconies being side by side. This makes it easy for neighboring guests to climb over and potentially steal from you. We learned that real quickly after sitting on ours.

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: arsene29
Reviews.Content: While planning our trip to Playa, we searched for a reasonable price hotel near the beach and found the All Riviera. We booked a deluxe room which according to the website was to include a king size bed and would give us all the comfort and pleasure for a complete relax. Wow….what a joke. We have traveled to many Caribbean islands and Central America we did not expect the Ritz’s for $132 a night but we were shocked by the room they tried to pass as a deluxe room. We were told this was the only room available and this is a deluxe room. If this is a deluxe room, I wonder what the standard room is like. We left the hotel and found a hotel that was 10 times nicer for $100 a night. Thank god, we booked through a local travel agency and were able to get a refund of our reservation money except for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great no frills, lower end cost place.”
Reviews.Author: DCKOHL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day vacation. Spent 5 days in Cancun at an all inclusive - Gran Caribe Real, and spent the next 5 days at the no-frills All Riveria Resort in Playa Del Carmen ("not all inclusive"). All Riverea Resort: Couldn't ask for a better location, beach is great, rooms have excellent view of ocean, a very short stroll to 5th ave. & very short stroll to the ferry to Cozumel. Rooms themselves were clean, but nothing special. The sink/mirror area is a bit small making getting ready to go out in the evenings a bit more challanging then when you can have your make-up/stuff sprawled out across a big counter. We stayed at the All Riveria Resort a few years back as well and they have since added safes and telephones to the rooms, which they didn't previously have. LOVED 5th Ave., especially in the evenings around dinner time. Tons of great restaurant choices. If you are strictly an "all-inclusive" type of person when it comes to your hotel or need a great hotel pool to be happy, this may not be the place for you - assume the pool is nonexistant. If you are looking for something a little more cost effective and your preference is to hang out on the beach rather than at a pool, this could be the perfect place for you - we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the All Riviera Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: T2000
Reviews.Content: I was here with some friends from February 3-10, 2007. I am not sure what the previous travellers were expecting, but this place was very nice. If you are looking for a great room with an excellent view, fun wait staff and beatiful beach and great location this is it! The free breakfast included pancakes, french toast, eggs, bacon, fruit, juice and coffee. The rooms were fine if all you are going to do is sleep. It was a basic room with a bed, tv, refrigerator and very nice shower/bathroom. Yes, the beds were a bit hard, but come on its Mexico in a standard room! The beach was excellent with NO rocks on the beach or for at least 20 yards out into the ocean. A crew came each morning to rake up any seaweed. We went down the beach to the North and the beaches there were more rocky and not as nice. The wait staff (Illadio, Pedro, Angelo, Jose) were great!! They wait on you hand and foot and were always friendly and smiling!! The drinks and food from the bar were also excellent. The location of this hotel on the beach is fantastic as well as the location from 5th Ave!!! 1 block up and you are right on 5th Ave with everything within walking distance. For a great time and great people - go to the All Riviera Resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Do It !!”
Reviews.Author: BenK
Reviews.Content: Playa del Carmen is a fantastic area with many great options for lodging, THIS IS NOT ONE OF THEM ! After walking by several times on the Beach while staying at a different resort this past fall we thought the All Riviera looked decent enough from the beach side so we booked it for the first week of Feb 07. We were looking for a decent budget hotel on the beach with no frills, our only expectations were clean & comfortable. We walked into the room and let me tell you that this is no clean comfortable hotel . The room we were put in was simply pathetic and as run down as can be . I pulled back the Blanket to find hairs on the oh so lovely yellow stained sheet, thats right YELLOW STAINS all over the sheet & strands of hairs . The bed (if you can call it that ) is a old worn mattress on a raised concrete block . I wouldnt for a second have my wife stay in this room ( or myself for that matter)... I wouldnt stay there for free let alone pay for it ! we walked out minutes later and stayed at the La Tortuga which is VERY nice and seemed like the Ritz Carlton after spending 3 minutes at the All riviera. Very Clean and comfortable with a staff that put the 3 other big dollar All Inclusive resorts we stayed at in the last 18 months to shame when it comes to service. SERIOUSLY take this advice , do NOT book this place as it needs to be bulldozed off the map and let someone come in that understands how to keep up a hotel....SIMPLY PATHETIC!! I have to seriously question a good review given to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “The staff will rob you here!”
Reviews.Author: infof4u
Reviews.Content: On our 2nd day here, our money ($450.00) was stolen out of our safe in our room (#207) at All Riviera Resort. No broken entry, and we had our room key at all times. We asked to speak with the manager, and they told us there wasn't one. We asked to speak with someone that deals with situations like this and they said the owner. We waited in the lobby for 7 hours waiting to speak with the owner. He never showed, and I asked for him to call us, and no call. If he did show, they never told me he was there, never called our room, they never apologized for the huge inconvience of my time, the fact that we were robbed. Nothing. I desperatly needed to speak with someone because I didn't want to spend another night there and since we prepaid online, we needed to be refunded for the 2 nights that we still had. We waited our entire vacation (the 3 more days) and still, no owner, no one would help us, the Hotel would not take responsibility, not even acknowledge us, or what happened. They were completely rude, unprofessional, forced us to stay another 2 unsafe nights because no one would talk to us about refunding us, so we can at least move to a different place. As we were walking to our rental car to leave for the airport a All Rivera Staff person brought over 3 police men and accused us of not paying for our room. I was in complete disbelief that this was happening. I was shaking, because I thought they had stolen our receipt (proof of payment) but we luckily had it. We had prepaid for all 5 nights in advance because we had to online and you have to show them this before checking in. So for them to sick the cops on us, after our miserable stay, and robbing us and room 204, and others, is so completely wrong, and I don't see how they sleep at night. When we arrived back to the states, I called International Vacation.com Inc. (who booked our stay with All Riviera), I explained what happened and that I still had not been contacted by the Owner. So she called the Hotel, and called me back saying that she spoke with the Owner and said he did speak with us and that we lost the key. He NEVER spoke with us for 3 days that we waited to speak to him. They are thieves and liars, please save yourselfs and don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Leave Valuables or $$$ in Your Room”
Reviews.Author: Talanski
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel the same time as marcie324 from New Jersey (Jan 24 review) and were the party who had the 3 (out of our 7) rooms "ransacked". Very disappointing!!! They even went thru dirty laundry bags. It's a good thing we saw our neighbors on the balcony who had $450 stolen that day or else we might not have been so careful about keeping our money with us at all times. After reporting having suitcases gone thru, the staff were very unfriendly and did a very poor job of cleaning our rooms. I had to ask for towels 4 different days. They would only leave 1 bath towel, or no hand towel. Not sure the sheets were changed either. We didn't let these things ruin our vacation but it sure made us stay on the lookout for problems. Don't think I can recommend this hotel. We might have considered moving to another but had paid for 6 nights already (for 7 rooms). Great location right on the beach and so close to 5th Ave. but don't believe the pictures you see. Be very careful if you stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Cynnkitty
Reviews.Content: The All Riviera is a great value for a great location! Our room opened right onto the beach. It was small and simple and a bit worn, but very clean. The staff was friendly and we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast a few times (on the other days we either slept in or wanted to try other restaurants). A few bucks a day in tips got us superb housekeeping. On a few days, our toiletries were artfully arranged in the bathroom, as if a sculpture. We found this engaging and charming. The beach bar/restaurant is a 'locals' place- meaning it seems to cater to vacationing Mexicans and other Central Americans. We liked feeling a part of the 'locals' scene. The beach took a hit from the rain while we were there and was rocky by the waters edge for the second half of our stay- but there was plenty of fine beach for swimming not far off in either direction. This isn't luxury by any stretch of the imagination, but it's cute and the value is superb for the beachfront location.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe rooms and room safe”
Reviews.Author: marsie324
Reviews.Content: My rooms and three other rooms rooms were robbed of cash and gold jewelry. NO FORCED entry. I was robbed of $650 cash and room 2 doors down was robbed of $450. 3 other rooms were ransacked and another luggage containing GOLD jewelry worth over $1200 stolen. Neither room locks, safe locks or luggage locks were damaged. We all filed police reports and Ministry of Justice forms. All happened on same day with a replacement maintenance person. Hotel owner refused to acknowledge us and stated "You have no Proof"!!! Stated just do what you have to. Guess he knows nothing will happen to him and he does not have to pay any of us for loss. Our vacations were ruined with several trips to Police, Ministry & Tourist Police. All no help. All Riviera is a very unsafe HOTEL..

Reviews.Title: “Beware of All Riviera”
Reviews.Author: OdysseusVII
Reviews.Content: Beware of a confirmed reservation at the All Riviera Hotel. After reserving and paying in advance, we were informed -- just two days before the travel date -- that they had overbooked, had cancelled our reservation, and were taking no responsibility for our stay in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: DANLO
Reviews.Content: While planning our trip to Playa, we searched for a reasonable price hotel near the beach and found the All RIviera. After seeing pictures on the Internet, we decided to check the hotel reviews, which all or the mayority said great or good things about the hotel, so we ended up booking our stay with them. When we arrived, we saw the hotel and were greatly disappointed. I was hoping that our room wouldn´t be that bad, but it was worse. I guess the pictures we saw on the Internet were taken many years ago when the hotel started business or maybe they fixed their best room to make us think that what we saw was what we would find....NOT AT ALL!! The hall leading to our room door smelled like fish, the a/c didn´t work, the pool was way too small, the beach...not nice. I can keep going...but I guess this is enough to give you an idea...DON´T ALWAYS TRUST WHAT YOU SEE OR READ ON THE INTERNET. Fortunately, since we didn´t book directly with the hotel, we were able to change plans and go to another hotel. We ended up in Hotel La Tortuga, which can´t even be compared to the All Riviera. It´s not by the beach, but it sure is a nice hotel and the pool is great.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Onat
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were supposed to stay at All Riviera Resort at Playa del Carmen during our trip to Riviera Maya. I paid $130/night for two nights. When we checked into our room, we could only tolerate it for two hours. The room was unbelievable. It was hardly worth $50/night, yet alone $130/night. The AC was loud, curtains had holes in them, glass was shattered, the bathroom was below par, bed was uncomfortable and looked dirty. We knew that there would be no phone and limited TV channels, but I thought those would be the only "drawbacks" that we would be happy to live with. But no, this place was no place that was worth $130. I would not give this hotel a single star rating. The only saving grace of the hotel was that it was literally right on the beach. However, in Playa all beaches are public, so forget privacy and quite and peace. There was music blasting right next to the hotel, the roooms looked unsafe, etc. It looked as if anybody could just walk in. We could only tolerate this hotel for 2 hours. I was not expecting an all inclusive quality, but I sure was expecting something more than a shack. Believe all the bad reviews you read here and do not stay at this hotel. We moved to an all inclusive resort for merely $40/night more and had a blast. If you are not on a budget, don't even consider this hotel. If you are on a budget, you can find much better hotels for less in Playa. Do not stay in this hotel! You will be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: shimmer765
Reviews.Content: The All Riviera Resort in Playa del Carmen is quaint and small and perfect for a couple or even a family. There is an on-site restaurant that serves the tables, as well as the beach chairs stretched across the front of the hotel. Pedro, our waiter, was very friendly and talked with us about the cool places to go, etc. The hotel included a breakfast "buffet," which was fantastic. Each morning we were able to order anything we wanted from the breakfast menu and it was included in the price of the room. I'm not into the all-inclusive resorts b/c I feel confined to their restaurant and we end up spending more money anyways b/c we like to try new places. But, the inclusive breakfast was perfect--pancakes, french toast, fresh fruit, toast...etc...all included. The room itself was clean. The AC worked just fine. There was no bathtub, just a shower and we had no problem whatsoever with hot water. The water pressure was perfect. The rooms are decorated simply with white walls, but the sink and fixtures in the bathroom were made decorative mexican tile. All of the rooms have oceanviews with either a balcony or patio (if you are on the first floor). We did not get in the pool, but I'm sure it was refreshing and it looked very clean. My only complaint would be the bed. The mattress, at least in our room, needed to be replaced. It was completly sunk in the middle and VERY uncomfortable. My boyfriend and I were huddled to each side of the bed, trying not to sink into the middle. I woke up both nights we stayed there with a backache in the morning. I'm not sure if all of the rooms are like that or not. Also, I'm not very keen on using the comforters in hotels. We tossed ours on the floor as it was pretty filthy. I'm not sure how often they clean them. It didn't matter though...we left the sliding glass door open at night with the ceiling fan on and it was the perfect temperature to sleep with just the sheet. We talked about it and would probably stay here again. The location is ideal, right on the beach and only a few steps from Avenida 5 (5th avenue)...the pedestrian mall with shops and restaurants. We loved the culture in Playa and to be honest didn't spend too much time in the hotel room anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Roof Top Nite Caps”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival from Cancun Airport we boarded the bus to Playa which placed us one block of our Hotel that is nestled in the no drive zone of Playa . We checked into the smaller U shaped three storey walkup Hotel with out any problem. After reading most of the reviews, there are travellers that want nothing but high end accomodations, and there are travellers that will appreciate the local flavor of this hotel. Main Floor rooms have patio doors opening onto the small grassed court yard which has a small kids unheated pool which is 20' from the waves washing up onto the small sandy beach. Second and Third floor rooms all had patio doors onto small deck facing court yard, again which looked out over Gulf. All rooms were cleaned daily, and there is a small bar/ restaurant on beach. The hard working staff are interesting people, and if you take the time to get to know them, you will gain another friend and may even be invited to meet their family. There were 8 of us in four rooms for two weeks and everyone has said they would do it again without hesitation. Every nite we would appoint a dinner boss who decided on the evenings dining(usually one of many restaurants on 5th Ave. one block up from our hotel) and we never went to the same spot twice, except the hot dog cart that we would stop at prior to a late dinner or after a long day of excursions. Most nites we would congregate for a nite cap on the roof over looking the gulf towards Cozumel. All though there was never a sunset to speak of (your facing east) the lights down the coast line made for a breath taking view. Private tours can be arranged thru many of the local licensed cab drivers, and if you're lucky your driver will be at your service your entire stay. Yes we never had the 40,000sq foot pool and we never had phones or even 300 TV channels to watch, but what we do have are good memories that will be with us for ever and a wish that we may go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “2 Timers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the All Riviera Resort the past two January's and both times have been great. Location in fantastic, prices are great and the staff is wonderful. Some renovations while there, but not bothersum. We used beach chairs one day while there and never got bothered by the wait staff. Very friendly. Our room was cleaned each day by mid afternoon.(tip for Omaha, try leaving a tip for the maid staff, and relax). You must remember you're in Mexico and time can stand still, showers may not always have the best pressure or "hot" water, and they do not all speak English. Try Cancun next time. For photos and additional info, e-mail is dorseyd@mn.rr.com Good luck and save travels.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Changitah
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice; once for a week, the second time for 3 weeks. Lovely location on the beach but not worth the hassles. They changed management and it is very poor. They do not respond to emails and usually you can not get an English speaking person if you call. We had booked our reservation 5 months before travel for a 3 week stay, had a confirmation number and made a down payment. When we arrived our room was not available. No manager to talk to (never saw one the entire stay) but were finally put in a small corner room for the night. We did get our front ocean view room late the next day, after many trips to the front desk. There are only 27 rooms and we don't know what the maids did all day. They were on site but our room was never cleaned until late late afternoon. We would return from the beach to clean up, relax and siesta before dinner and the room would be dirty. We would end up on the balcony when they cleaned the room at 4:30-5:00. Sheets were changed once a week, pillows had black mildew and smelled. Hot water and water pressure were not constant. You would be soaped up in the shower and then have to try to rinse off in a cold dribble of water. Many times we had NO water and would have to wait 1-2 hours before we could clean up. Beach chairs were to be provided free to guests but the waiters would charge you if they could get away with it. Beach chairs were broken with torn filthy cushions. Hotel guests were banished to the back rows with the prime water front chairs held for people the waiters could rent them to. Waiters were very rude to hotel guests and tried to overchange us several times for food/drink orders. We ran into many people who arrived with a confirmed reservation and were told the hotel was full - no room for you. Room prices are all over the place. We talked to people paying anywhere from $45 a night to $150 a night; for the same week at this hotel and comparable rooms. We talked to people who stayed there in 2005 and they had the same problems. Others had reservations but had no room when they arrived. When we learned that things had not improved, and if anything were worse, we decided not to stay there again. We spend 2-3 weeks in Playa every year. This location on the beach is very nice and convenient but it is not worth the treatment you have to put up with. I would not trust them to have a room for you, even if you have a confirmed reservation. There are many wonderful hotels in Playa with reasonable prices, clean comfortable rooms and a pleasant caring staff. I wanted to write a review to warn other travelers earlier but only recently found this format. After reading other reviews I decided I should add mine.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Wow! We stayed here for 7 nights, and had an amazing time! This hotel has the nicest beach BY FAR, plus it is a 30 second walk to 5th Avenue. The staff are so friendly and accomodating. If you are looking for a 5 star hotel, then this is not the place. But if you are looking for a beachfront hotel at a reasonable price, this is the place to go. We couldn't believe how cheap the rooms were ($70 U.S. a night). We were on the bottom level with patio doors opening to the ocean. The restaurants on 5th Avenue are unbelievable. Great service and the food here is all about taste and presentation. If you want to enjoy a great vacation, the All Riviera is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but problems”
Reviews.Author: eastman999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I flew into cancun and took an airport transfer (Cancun Valet was excellent) to Playa Del Carmen. We boooked this resort through Travelocity and we get there to find out this resort (if you want to call it that) had no computer and no one that speaks english. Not sure how you book online with a resort that has not computer. So of course no one spoke English but then again we are in Mexico, and it turns out they did not have our reservation. We showed the man all of our confirmations and he let us stay for the night so we could talk to the lady in the morning at which time we had to pay the resort again, after we already paid through Travelocity. Anyway I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. Pros. Great Ocean View, bottled water in room, air conditioned, and had a tv. Cons Aside from the whole paragraph above......Studio style Rooms and the sheets felt like they hadn't been changed in a month. No telephone in the rooms. Great place to stay if you are used to Hostels and camping. Not good for Honeymoon stays or if you are looking to be pampered. Just hope they have your reservation when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal For The Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: FairfieldDan
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at All Riviera. The beach is kind of small and the rooms were very basic but Hey...we were expecting an $80.00 a nite hotel!!!! It's a thirty second walk to 5th for nighttime activities, 2 minutes walk to the ferry, and the on site restaurant was good food at a really affordable price. If you don't expect mints on your pillow, you will enjoy this hotel for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just returned from 4 nights at the all riviera resort . 8 guy's on an annual fishing / diving trip , without our families . we chose the all riviera for it's location and price. we knew in advance that an $ 85 per night beach front room would not be like staying at the ritz carlton . we were satisfied with the quality..for the price . the previous reviews about the difficulty in finding the place are accurate . just have your transportation drop you at the playa bus terminal .. and walk , or hire a porter to tote your luggage the 2 blocks to the hotel... taxis are NOT allowed past the bus terminal . the rooms are spartan , but clean. no pictures on the wall , no fancy tile, no telephone in the room . there's a t.v. and an airconditioner that are more than adequate . the bathroom was utilitarian , but clean.. sometimes there was adequate hot water and pressure , other times not..get over it.. what do you expect for $ 85 . the reports of a foul sewage smell was inaccurate. some of us had twins others kings .. all rooms are pretty much the same. i think i counted about 36 rooms in total . the employees at the front desk were friendly and helpful. no phones was a bit of an adjustment.. so you buy a phone card at the shops next door ( 30 min for $10 ) and use payphones that are on each street corner. the hotels location is perfect and it's beach is the nicest. the hotels beach bar is open to the public .. the chaise lounges are plastic with fairly worn out seat cushions . the hotels beach and bar attracts a nice mix of american and european guests along with local mexican families . the cervesa is cold and the tequila and rum flow freely . the staff are colorful friendly characters. we never ate the food at the hotel ..however they appear to do a brisk lunch business. the pool is very small and gets filled with kids that are not staying at the hotel...consequently , we never went in . the reviews of no beach towels are inaccurate.. just ask at the front desk and show your room key .. they had plenty . if you're used to a four star resort .. this is not for you .. if you want a guick inexpensive blast of sun , stay on the beach , and be within walking distance of over 100 fun bars and decent cheap restaurants .. then you might give the all riviera a try.. just don't expect too much in the way of luxury .

Reviews.Title: “Good Time!”
Reviews.Author: Princessashley500
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the All Riveria in Feb. 2004, my mother and father, myself, husband(in our 20's) and 3 year old daughter. Have to admit at first I was disappointed w/ the room and resort. This was my 3rd time in Mexico, first time that was not an all inclusive resort. All in all it ended up being one of the best vacations ever! The beach was nice, plenty of chairs. Good view of the beach from the balacony. The pool is very small and isn't much but our daugther still enjoyed it! Not much variety in the food area, so we ended up spending quite a bit eating out. Very good location for walking into town to eat, shop, sightsee, etc... My father and husband went deep sea fishing, had a great time. We went to Xel-ha by the bus, about $1.50 ride/ took about 20 min. I would strongly recommend going to Xel-ha early in the morning and making a day of it!! We also took a bus into Cancun for dinner one evening...long ride...took little over an hour, wouldn't really recommend. We also took the ferry to Cozumel to ride the submarine...very cool! Overall, it was great for the 5 days we were there pretty basic not a fancy resort.
